channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Thinking of buying the stock-market dip? Here’s what you should know.
Secret Service shoots armed man near the White House after getting report of ‘suicidal individual’
item.description: President Donald Trump was in Florida at the time of the shooting.

item.title: Musk calls on US to quit NATO, stop paying for defense of Europe
item.description: Trump said he told NATO allies that if they’re not going to pay their bills, he won’t defend them.

item.title: HHS workers who research diseases, inspect food and administer Medicare and Medicaid are offered $25,000 buyouts
item.description: The workers have until 5 p.m. on Friday to submit a response for the so-called voluntary separation offer.

item.title: DoorDash’s stock pops on S&P 500 nod. Here’s who else is joining the index.
New York governor declares state of emergency for wind-driven brush fire on Long Island
item.description: She said homes, a chemical factory and an Amazon warehouse were at risk and more evacuations may be needed.

item.title: Social Security to increase overpayment withholdings to 100% from 10%
Stocks end higher on Powell remarks, but S&P 500 still posts worst week of 2025
Most Americans don’t matter to the economy like they used to
Technofascism Is Here. We Have One Way Out
item.description: Big Tech has taken control of our democracy. The answer is to build decentralized platforms these companies can't control.
